TopicTitle: How important is mystery goo to you?

Articles.Content: With 0.22 mystery goo has been added! The question is, how important is mystery goo to you?

With 0.22 mystery goo has been added! The question is, how important is mystery goo to you?

Lot of sweet, sweet Science!Ã¢â€žÂ¢ in every canister. You better believe it's important!
Does it worth it to install more than one canister on a single vessle??
It's a mystery to me
I love Mystery goo. Although Ive begun to believe its an alien life form, since it says "it feels right at home" in deep interplanetary space..

Does it worth it to install more than one canister on a single vessle??

Only if you plan on returning that vessel with the science because you cant transmit it. (Lack of power eg.)

Does it worth it to install more than one canister on a single vessle??

Yes! More Goo = MOAR SCIENCE!

Also, if nothing else it keeps your center of mass if you orient them symmetrically.

I love Mystery goo. Although Ive begun to believe its an alien life form, since it says "it feels right at home" in deep interplanetary space..

I think the same think. It is friendly, as if it would be hostile, it would just escape the canister and eat your kerbals.
Shouldn't 'Same as Kerbals.' be the first ? :b

Shouldn't 'Same as Kerbals.' be the first ? :b

I did not count for the kerbal-killing players. Kerbals are always more important than normal parts, as you can also torture them with giant rocket powered blenders. (Yes, I actually did that!)
Yes you can do experiments in different places depending your mission profile
It is part of my daily recommended breakfast.
I'm wondering if mystery goo is the waste product of the Kerbal to Kethane converter.

I try not to destroy it.

But only so it doesn't escape and kill everyone.
I think the mystery goo is baby Kerbals. We send them up so they get used to traveling in space before they start their careers. Therefore, I treat the mystery goo as a Kerbal.

I love Mystery goo. Although Ive begun to believe its an alien life form, since it says "it feels right at home" in deep interplanetary space..

Strange, I got the same message orbiting Minmus while harvesting some sweet science points so I figured Minmus or a similar satellite may be the origin of the goo.

You have to keep it safely aboard your ship, because if you jettison it into deep space, it will eventually land on a planet, and begin to evolve into a race of super inteligent Kerbal-Eating slime monsters, who will develop space travel and will one day encounter the kerbal interstellar Empire, and will consume all that is Kerbal!
Same message around Duna and Ike. Goo is just homesick and will love any celestial body.

I have noticed something about the goo during my "Experiments". It reacts to its current location, and since space outside of an atmosphere is the same everywhere its going to be the same experiment. Its possible it takes gravity into effect but the Mun and Minmus have such minimal gravity fields it probably has no effect. I havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t landed on either yet so more "Experiments" are needed. When I get the ability to do so, im gonna try dipping some science instruments into Jools atmosphere and try to get it back out again. That will be fun.

I have noticed something about the goo during my "Experiments". It reacts to its current location, and since space outside of an atmosphere is the same everywhere its going to be the same experiment. Its possible it takes gravity into effect but the Mun and Minmus have such minimal gravity fields it probably has no effect. I havenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t landed on either yet so more "Experiments" are needed. When I get the ability to do so, im gonna try dipping some science instruments into Jools atmosphere and try to get it back out again. That will be fun.

Bring some radio equipment as backup. You can at least transmit the data back before plunging to the depths.
I dunno... but I'm not too sure about blowing the "Goo" up...
So, is this "goo" a beginning at resources? Think about it... We can go to a planet where it feels comfortably and possible harvest it and turn it into something useful!
I wasn't aware that Goo could be killed. That said, I would never kill or destroy it... intentionally. >_>
I try to protect the goo just like. I protect my Kerbals. I was a bit upset last night when my goo escaped into the ocean. Very rude of it.

I try to protect the goo just like. I protect my Kerbals. I was a bit upset last night when my goo escaped into the ocean. Very rude of it.

I also would protect it.
